title: Bollini 2014 Barricato 40 Chardonnay (Collio)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting white flower, orchard fruit and bread crust. The straightforward palate delivers Golden Delicious apple and a hint of peach alongside crisp acidity.

title: Château Pavie Macquin 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. The high acidity in this wine is tight and bright, overly so. It seems unbalanced, while the firm tannins lend a gripping structure.

title: Comelli 2013 Locum Nostrum Malvasia (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Aromas of citrus, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of geranium lead open on the nose. The tangy palate offers apricot, yellow peach and candied nectarine zest along crisp acidity. A note of bitter almond signals the close.

title: Conti Formentini 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Aromas of orchard fruit, citrus and nuts come together on this. The vibrant palate offers lemon zest, Kaiser pear and a hint of stony mineral accompanied by bracing acidity.

title: Covila 2014 II Tinto  (Rioja)
description: Tutti-frutti aromas are snappy. This young Rioja feels juicy and bright, with plum, raspberry and red-currant flavors that hold steady on the finish without making a fuss.

title: Dão Sul NV Encontro Brut Rosé Touriga Nacional (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)
description: This pink-colored wine is attractively fruity with crisp acidity and fresh red currant fruits. It's light, bright and soft with a lightly creamy texture.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2012 Griffin's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A limited production blend, this opens with tart, brambly fruit flavors accented with mild herbs. The finish continues down a brambly, peppery path. Best to give this until 2017 or so in bottle.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Portuga Red (Lisboa)
description: With Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, this is a strongly structured wine. It is dark and tannic, acidity laced with dark plum flavors. This firm wine is still young and should be aged for at least a year, so drink from 2017.

title: Castel Sallegg 2014 Pulvernai Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Lightly scented with citrus blossom and orchard fruit, this racy white offers up delicate flavors of yellow apple and lemon zest. It's linear, with vibrant acidity that leaves a crisp finish.

title: Chalk Hill 2013 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)
description: From estate-grown grapes, this is a fulsome, generously expansive wine, rich in honeyed vanilla, caramel and toffee, and intense in oak. Peach and hazelnut figure into the mix, as does a taste of nutmeg, making for a warm, lengthy finish.

title: Château de Sancerre 2012  Sancerre
description: This is a soft, fruity wine that is already mature. It still has berry and red plum fruitiness although this is now integrated with the gentle tannic structure. The freshness comes from juicy acidity that creeps in at the end to leave a fresh aftertaste.

title: Chateau Grand Traverse 2012 Reserve Gamay (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: While there are not many acres of Gamay in Michigan, it seems to be an viable addition to the rows of Pinot throughout the the state's two northern AVAs. From a warmer vintage, this wine shows plenty of red cherry and strawberry alongside lightly toasted vanilla. While juicy and snappy, a light dusting of tannins offers just enough support.

title: 2 Lads 2012 Reserve Sparkling  (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: This is a fruit-forward, attractive sparkling wine made from Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. Ripe orchard fruits—from red apple to Bosc pear—are carried by mouth-filling foam.

title: 2 Lads 2013 Cuvée Beatrice Pinot Noir (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: Ripe black cherry dipped in cola marks the nose of this bold offering. With 13 months in French oak (50% new and 50% second use), the palate carries some weight, offering dense black cherry supported by grainy tannins. A tensile line of cranberry acidity draws everything to the vanilla-laden close.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 Bridão Colheita Seleccionada Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)
description: The dark color of the Alicante Bouschet is very obvious in this wine along with the ripe juicy fruitiness. It has a fine dusty texture that balances the black plum fruits and acidity. The wine is developing quickly and will be ready to drink by the end of 2016.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 Bridão Reserva Tinto Red (Tejo)
description: A ripe and soft wine that has juicy acidity and succulent blackberry fruits. There are just enough tannins and spice to give the wine structure, although it is certainly ready to drink now.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 Private Collection Red (Tejo)
description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Castelão, this is a wine that is almost too rich, too intense. Its dense texture and background of tannins are balanced with black currant acidity; however, the high alcohol does show with pepper and tongue-burning spice. That won't go away, although the texture will soften. Drink from 2017.

title: Adega Mãe 2013 Pinot Noir (Lisboa)
description: Forget Burgundy, this is a rich, New World style of Pinot Noir, concentrated and without great subtlety. It is just black fruit, dense tannins and some bitter extraction that shows in the dark coffee flavors. It should calm down somewhat although still with a sense of power. Drink from 2017.

title: Airlie 2014 Two Vineyard Old Vines Dry Riesling (Willamette Valley)
description: Made from vines planted in 1978 and 1983, this is a clean and fresh wine, a bit under-ripe with celery stalk, green apple and lemon flavors. Residual sugar is barely noticeable at 8g/L.

title: Andriano 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Softly scented, this offers aromas of spring blossom and summer orchard fruit. The luminous, easygoing palate shows pear and citrus alongside crisp acidity. It finishes clean and fresh.

title: Argento 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Plum, raspberry and spice aromas stick out on this otherwise dusty smelling Cabernet. This is medium in body, with little in the midsection. Reedy, oaky red-berry flavors come with a cocoa powder note and a spicy finish.

title: Attems 2013 Cicinis Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Aromas of toast, nut, oak and yellow stone fruit emerge on this linear white. The palate is rather lean, offering grapefruit, mineral, thyme and a hint of roasted coffee bean alongside crisp acidity.

title: Dürer-Weg 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Apple, wildflower and stone aromas set the tone. The tangy palate offers crisp Granny Smith apple, pear and nectarine accompanied by lively acidity. A touch of mineral closes the finish.

title: Don Miguel Gascón 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Tutti-frutti aromas seem powdery and suggestive of crushed stones. The palate on this tasty Malbec is fresh and fair. Blackberry and mild pepper flavors end lean and quick.

title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2013 Amantis Reserva Viognier (Alentejano)
description: Wood-aging, toasty aromas give this wine a ripe, creamy character that probably has too much wood and not enough fruit. There are spices, flavors of croissants and just a hint of yellow fruits. Drink now.

title: Dorigo 2013 Ronc di Juri Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Fermented and aged in wood, this opens with aromas of toast, dried yellow fruit and a whiff of green bell pepper. The linear—almost lean—palate offers unripe peach, vanilla and a mineral note alongside crisp acidity.

title: Dorigo 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Aromas of chamomile and summer orchard fruit delicately float out of the glass. The zesty palate offers yellow apple, white peach and a hint of bitter almond alongside vibrant acidity. It finishes crisp and clean.

title: Draga 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Delicate aromas of tomato leaf, citrus and a whiff of chopped herb unfold in the glass. The vibrant palate offers yellow grapefruit, green melon and mineral alongside bracing acidity.

title: Finca Flichman 2013 Paisaje de Tupungato Red (Mendoza)
description: This Malbec-led blend offers blueberry and Middle Eastern spice aromas but also a sense of reduction and nuttiness on the nose. A tight palate is juicy but lacks definition and mouthfeel. Herbal blueberry flavors finish jammy.

title: Finca La Emperatriz 2012 Cepas Viejas Viura (Rioja)
description: Gold in color and charred to the max, this Viura is dominated by the barrel. Aromas of toast and butter smother any fruit that might want to get out. The palate is creamy, as is the flavor profile, then bitter char and heavy oak come back on the finish. How much oak is too much oak? You be the judge.
